title: Great British Bake Off Belgian version suffers best cake fail
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

The Great British Bake Off might pack an array of fancy showstoppers, but our international cousins seem to be operating on an entirely different level.

In the Belgian version of the baking show, titled Bake Off Vlaanderen (Bake Off Flanders), an episode from the third series which aired last month saw a contestant build a cake suspended on a pole in what resembles a chandelier.

Jaline’s incredible cake construction, however, faces the inevitable when confronted by judges Regula Ysewijn and Herman Van Dender – with the cake collapsing to the floor before they’ve even got to the taste test.

The beautiful cake… (Picture: Vier)

… hits the floor (Picture: Vier)

While Jaline and the judges break into shocked hysterics, it takes roughly 10 seconds before the cake turmoil devastation creeps in – resulting in emotional hugs and tears all round.

Moral of the story? Probably don’t hang cakes like chandeliers, to be honest.

Jaline on the Belgian version of Bake Off (Picture: Vier)

The British version has delivered shocks too in the recent episode, after favourite Henry Bird was eliminated in the quarter final.

There are only four contestants left in the current series in David, Alice, Rosie, and Steph, who are all fighting to be crowned the best baker of them all.

The Great British Bake Off continues Tuesday Channel 4 at 8pm.
